Wouldn't feedback be akin to results in an experiment? If viewers are disappointed with the video, you might want to look at why it didn't live up to their expectations. For the sake of improvement, it's no good dismissing the viewer's opinion on the grounds that they shouldn't watch things they don't like.

Tl;dr: negative feedback is still feedback, and should be taken into account.
